instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead after Waterdamage
threads.message:
Hey i have a Macbook Mainboard here <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A.

It was a waterdamage. i clean all and all looks ok now.
I have dfu i tried dfu revive. but failed with (AMRestoreErrorDomain error -1)

did you know what i am missing?

Any chance for data? can i swap t2 and nand to new mainboard?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead after Waterdamage
threads.message:
Something more affected by corrosion for sure.
Possibly corroded traces, or passive components (resistors, capacitors).
May also have accumulated crap underneath some BGA chips.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead after Waterdamage
threads.message:
okee is it possible to swap boards? 
what do i need ?

T2 chip? nands?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead after Waterdamage
threads.message:
Data is encrypted and the key is stored into T2.
You can try swaping both T2 and NAND at same time, but not sure if helps.
T2 will detect all the changes in the peripherals and may enter into recovery.
